page.title: 05The Needlework At Notgrove
page.content: The Needlework in St. Bartholomews Church is an unique example of modern craftsmanship worked in Cross and Tent stitch. It covers the blank East wall of the Church, replacing the 14th century rerodos destroyed in the Reformation. The Needlework was designed by Colin Skelton Anderson of Notgrove Manor taking 11 years to complete, being finished in 1954. It shows a summer scene in bright colours with the village on the right of the Church and the Manor on the left. The whole is surrounded by a twisting scroll of Hazel leaves and nuts. The initials of all the principal workers are included in the frieze. Several members of the Anderson family worked on the Needlework helped by friends in the village.
